New Records: New Zealand scored 172/7 in 23.2 overs to win by 5 wickets.
Devon Conway scored 45, Rachin Ravindra scored 42, Daryl Mitchell scored 43, and Glenn Phillips scored 17* for New Zealand.
Kusal Perera scored 51, Maheesh Theekshana scored 38*, Dilshan Madushanka scored 19, and Dhananjaya de Silva scored 19 for Sri Lanka.
Key Match Events: New Zealand openers Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra provided a strong start but quickly lost wickets.
Dilshan Madushanka and Maheesh Theekshana formed a crucial partnership for Sri Lanka, adding 42 runs in 81 balls.
Trent Boult took 3 wickets for 37 runs, Lockie Ferguson took 2 wickets for 35 runs, and Mitchell Santner took 2 wickets for 22 runs for New Zealand.
Pre-Game Insights: Kane Williamson won the toss and opted to bat first.
Tim Southee dismissed Pathum Nissanka in the second over, setting back Sri Lanka's innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Trent Boult was awarded 'Player of the Match' for his impressive bowling performance.
The win boosted New Zealand's position in the World Cup standings, with 10 points and a net run rate of +0.743.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a 'do-or-die' for New Zealand, who needed to secure a win to progress closer to the semi-finals.
Sri Lanka's tailend batters showed resilience, but their top order struggled against New Zealand's bowling attack.
